(I wrote this a few weeks back, but forgot to put in a subject. Oops.)

We hacked up an earlier version of JUnit to scan through all jar 
files in the classpath and run all found tests. Our solution required 
JDK 1.2, even though (for now) most of our developers are stuck on 
JDK 1.1 (we're hoping to move from MS J++ soon). 

Obviously this is not good -- having our developers run against a 
different JDK version than our tests. 

I'm trying to clean things up, so I'm ripping out our custom hacks 
and upgrading to JUnit 3.5. I notice the new classpath scanning code 
(in ClassPathTestCollector et al), but also notice that the comments 
state that JAR scanning is not implemented. 

I tried Duncan McGregor's ZipAwareLoadingTestRunner and haven't had 
any luck -- various class loading and null pointer problems (not in 
his code). 

So my question is: Has anyone managed to get JUnit to scan the 
classpath and execute tests in all jar files using JDK 1.1? 

thanks in advance, 
Simon
subject: Can JUnit successfully scan JAR files?
